# UPGMA

UPGMA stands for **U**nweighted **P**air **G**roup **M**ethod with **A**rithmetic mean. It is a simple _hierarchical clustering method_ that can be used to produce a rooted dendrogram. This dendrogram represents the structure (_clustering_) of relationships in a dataset and, _when the dataset represents evolutionary distances_ can be used to produce an evolutionary tree.

## Let's build a tree!

```{r echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
data <- readr::read_tsv("assets/data/chocolate_full.tab",
                          col_types="ciiiiiiiiiiiiiii")
rownames(data) <- data$`Chocolate Bar`
flextable::flextable(data)
```


```{r echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
hc_choc = hclust(dist(data), method="average")
plot(hc_choc, labels=rownames(data))
```
